comment: The binomial theorem: ` ( A + B ) ^ N ` is the sum from ` k = 0 ` to ` N ` of ` ( N _C k ) x. ( ( A ^ k ) x. ( B ^ ( N - k ) ) ` . Theorem 15-2.8 of [Gleason] p. 296. This part of the proof sets up the induction and does the base case, with the bulk of the work (the induction step) in ~ binomlem . This is Metamath 100 proof #44. (Contributed by NM, 7-Dec-2005.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 24-Apr-2014.)
